0.title: CBI summons TMC leader Anubrata in cattle smuggling case
0.article_body: The CBI on Friday summoned TMC's Birbhum district chief Anubrata Mondal in connection with the cattle smuggling case. He has been asked to appear before the investigators at 11 am on Monday. His security personnel Saigal Hussain has also been arrested by the agency. During the probe, the CBI has found huge property in the name of Hussain.

1.title: Pune man cheats investor of ₹4 cr by promising 24% returns; booked
1.article_body: Pune's Sinhgad police have booked a man for allegedly cheating an investor of over ₹4 crore by promising him 24% returns on the pretext of investing the money. The accused had floated a company which handled forex trading, share trading and construction, according to the FIR. The case was filed under IPC Section 420 (cheating) and the Information Technology Act.

2.title: Unclog jails to mark 75 years of India's Independence: SC to Centre
2.article_body: Unclogging prisons and trial courts could be a perfect way of celebrating 75 years of India's independence, Supreme Court told the central government on Friday. It urged the Centre to work with states and Union Territories to come up with measures where certain categories of undertrials and convicts could be released. "You must think out of the box," SC said.

3.title: Pelosi is the worst destroyer of international peace: North Korea
3.article_body: North Korea said US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is "the worst destroyer of international peace and stability", accusing her of inciting anti-North Korea sentiment while visiting South Korea and enraging China during her Taiwan visit this week. "It would be a fatal mistake for her to think that she can go scot-free in the Korean Peninsula," North Korea added.

4.title: 1st Muslim woman in North Kerala to get English education dies at 95
4.article_body: Maliyekkal Mariyumma, first Muslim woman in North Kerala to get English education, passed away aged 95 on Friday in Kannur district. Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan expressed grief over her death. "We have lost a person who had left her indelible footprints along with the history of Thalassery....Her death plunges a generation and a region into grief," the Chief Minister said.

5.title: No sympathy for madrasas' bad elements, govt should shoot them: AIUDF chief
5.article_body: The All India United Democratic Front chief Maulana Badruddin Ajmal said that the party has no sympathy for the "bad elements" in madrasas. "Government should shoot them wherever they find them. If one or two bad teachers are found at madrasas, the government should impose detentions and pick them up once inquiry completes and do whatever they want," he added.

6.title: Man arrested for illegal possession of firearm, bullets in Hyderabad
6.article_body: The Hyderabad police on Friday arrested a 43-year-old man for illegally possessing a country-made firearm. Police also recovered eight live rounds from the accused, identified as Rakesh Tyagi. According to police, Tyagi works at a private diagnostic centre and is a native of Madhya Pradesh. He was arrested while trying to sell the firearm to prospective buyers, police added.

7.title: Actress Anne Heche critical after crashing car into house in Los Angeles
7.article_body: American actress Anne Heche is critical after crashing her car into a house in Los Angeles. The impact left the car and the house engulfed in flames, police said. "Fifty-nine firefighters took 65 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish the stubborn flames within the heavily damaged structure," Los Angeles Fire Department said.

8.title: Sick mind: Jairam on Shah linking Congress' protest to Ram Mandir
8.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Friday reacted to Union Home Minister Amit Shah linking the party's protest to Ram Mandir's foundation day, saying, "It's only a sick mind which can produce such bogus arguments." Shah had claimed that Congress choosing to protest wearing black clothes on anniversary of Ram Mandir's foundation day was a "subtle message to...promote their appeasement politics".

9.title: I was drug tested by US govt for a year: Musk on smoking weed with Joe Rogan
9.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in a podcast interview said he was drug tested by the US government after he smoked weed on Joe Rogan's podcast in 2018. "The consequences for me and for SpaceX were actually not good...I had...to prove that I'm not...a drug addict," Musk said. He added that he was randomly drug tested for everything for a year.

10.title: Hat-trick at CWG proves Bajrang has champion's consistency: Anurag Thakur
10.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur tweeted that wrestler Bajrang Punia has shown he has a "champion's consistency" after winning a third consecutive medal at CWG. Bajrang won his second consecutive gold medal at CWG, after beating Canada's Lachlan McNeil in the final of the men's freestyle 65 kg category at CWG 2022. Bajrang had won a silver medal at CWG 2014.

11.title: 27 get life sentence in 2018 Dalit triple murder case in Tamil Nadu's Kachanatham
11.article_body: A court on Friday sentenced 27 persons to life imprisonment in the 2018 triple murder of Dalit men in Kachanatham village in Tamil Nadu's Sivaganga. The victims were hacked to death in a feud related to paying respects at a temple festival. Notably, five more Dalit people had sustained injuries, of which one died one and half years later.

12.title: Greek intelligence chief resigns amid wiretapping allegations
12.article_body: The head of Greece's intelligence service has resigned amid allegations that a journalist and an opposition politician had their mobile phones targeted by spying software. Panagiotis Kontoleon submitted his resignation "following mistaken actions found during lawful wiretapping procedures", PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis' office said. Secretary-General of the PM's office, Grigoris Dimitriadis, also quit.

13.title: Wasn't bothered even when 0-4 down in final: Sakshi after CWG gold medal
13.article_body: Wrestler Sakshi Malik said she wasn't bothered when 0-4 down in the women's freestyle 62 kg final against Canada's Ana Godinez at CWG 2022. Sakshi made a comeback to win her first CWG gold medal. "I'd won bouts with seconds left," added Sakshi. Discussing her double leg move in the final, Sakshi stated, "I can do [it] in my sleep."

14.title: I was clean-shaven in 2 films, both films were shaved too: Anil Kapoor
14.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor recently appeared on the OTT show 'Case Toh Banta Hai'. He was asked by actor Ritesh Deshmukh why he didn't keep his moustache after 1991 film 'Lamhe'. Anil said, "Do film mein mooche safa ki thi, unfortunately film bhi safa ho gayi yaar (I was clean-shaven in two films, unfortunately both films got shaved off too)."

15.title: Voting to elect the Vice-President of India begins
15.article_body: The voting for the Vice-Presidential election began on Saturday. For the 16th Vice-Presidential election, the Electoral College consists of 233 elected members of Rajya Sabha, 12 nominated members of Rajya Sabha, and 543 elected members of Lok Sabha. NDA has nominated Jagdeep Dhankhar as their candidate, while the Opposition fielded Margaret Alva as their candidate for the post.

16.title: China simulating attack on our main island: Taiwan
16.article_body: Taiwan's Defence Ministry has said that multiple batches of Chinese planes and ships were spotted crossing median line of Taiwan Strait. "They were judged to be conducting a simulation of an attack on Taiwan's main island," the ministry added. This comes amid heightened tensions between China and Taiwan after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan.

17.title: Paytm Q1 net loss widens to ₹644 crore, revenue jumps 89%
17.article_body: Paytm's parent company One97 Communications on Friday said that its consolidated loss widened to ₹644.4 crore in the quarter ended June 30 as against a net loss of ₹380.2 crore in the corresponding period last year. Its consolidated revenue from operations increased 89% to ₹1,680 crore year-on-year from ₹891 crore. Paytm's shares closed 3.06% lower at ₹784.30 on Friday.

18.title: Instead of GDP, govt bothered about DP: TMC MP Mahua Moitra
18.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra on Friday said the central government has an "uncanny knack" of ignoring what's important and concentrating on headlines. "For example...when we should be looking at...GDP (Gross Domestic Product), we're being exhorted...to concentrate on our DPs (display pictures)," she added. This comes after PM Modi urged people to put Tricolour as their display picture on social media.

19.title: Nykaa Q1 profit rises by 42% to ₹5 crore, revenue jumps 41%
19.article_body: Nykaa parent company FSN E-Commerce Ventures on Friday posted a 42.24% rise in its consolidated net profit to ₹5.01 crore in the quarter ended June as against ₹3.52 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. Its consolidated revenue from operations grew 40.56% to ₹1,148.4 crore year-on-year. Nykaa's shares on Friday closed at ₹1,411.25 after dropping 2.30%.

20.title: Woman helps nab man who snatched her gold chain: Rachakonda Police
20.article_body: Rachakonda Police has tweeted that a woman helped catch a man who tried to escape after snatching her gold chain in Hayathnagar. The accused allegedly entered the house where woman was staying by posing as a prospective tenant, threw chilli powder at her and snatched her chain. The woman held on to accused and raised an alarm, an official said.

21.title: Uttar Pradesh announces 48 hours of free bus rides for women on Raksha Bandhan
21.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday announced free bus rides for women for 48 hours, starting from August 10 midnight till August 12 midnight. "On the occasion of Raksha Bandhan, the Uttar Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation will provide free travel facility in buses for the safe travel of all the women," CM Yogi's office tweeted.

22.title: Delhi people to be rewarded for detecting dummy IEDs in mock drills: Report
22.article_body: The Delhi Police has decided to reward people who detect dummy Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) placed during mock security drills, reports said. Reports added that the decision was taken after Delhi Police Special Cell "infiltrated and planted" 30 dummy IEDs in places with high footfall. Of the total, 12 were detected by the public, private security guards and local police.

23.title: Musk invents representations we never made: Twitter on merger deal
23.article_body: Responding to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's counterclaims about their deal, Twitter in a 127-page document stated that Musk "invents representations Twitter never made". It added, "Musk asserts...his own analysis…[indicating] that false or spam accounts constitute at least 10% of Twitter's monetisable daily active users…He is not measuring the same thing as Twitter or even using the same data as Twitter."

24.title: BJP leader abuses, pushes woman at Noida society; video of the incident surfaces
24.article_body: Shrikant Tyagi, who identifies himself on social media as a national executive member of BJP's Kisan Morcha, has been booked for threatening and abusing a woman after a spat with her inside a housing society in Noida. The woman objected to plantation of some trees by Tyagi. In a video of the incident, Tyagi can be seen pushing the woman.

25.title: I was bullied for weight gain, broke down many times: Harnaaz Sandhu
25.article_body: Harnaaz Sandhu, who was crowned Miss Universe 2021, revealed that she was bullied for gaining weight and broke down multiple times. She said that she worked out constantly during the pageant and had a month to relax afterward. "During that time, I...didn't work out...I was just eating and...enjoying...time with...family. I never realised...it would start showing on my body," Harnaaz added.

26.title: Mumbai maid looks for missing girl online, reunites her with mom after 9 yrs
26.article_body: A domestic help, Pramila Devendra, reunited 16-year-old girl, Pooja, with her mother in Mumbai, nine years after she was kidnapped in 2013. Devendra searched Pooja's name on Google after she told her people she lives with are not her real parents. Devendra found some missing reports with numbers, following which Pooja was able to talk to her mother over call.

27.title: Punishes the world: US on China suspending bilateral climate talks
27.article_body: US Special Envoy on Climate Change John Kerry said that China's decision to suspend bilateral talks on climate change with the US "doesn't punish" Washington, "it punishes the world". "No country should withhold progress on existential transnational issues because of bilateral differences," Kerry added. China suspended the bilateral talks after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan.

28.title: Wrote script in 14 days but Aamir didn't read it for 2 yrs: 'Laal...' writer
28.article_body: Actor and 'Laal Singh Chaddha' writer Atul Kulkarni said actor Aamir Khan did not read his script for two years, having written it in 14 days. "Aamir said, 'You are not a writer...and I don't want to disappoint you by saying you have written very badly'," added Atul. "That is why he wasn't listening to the script," he stated.

29.title: BBMP ward reservation list in favour of BJP MLAs, MPs: Congress
29.article_body: Congress on Friday criticised the BJP-led government in Karnataka for alleged "discrimination" in the reservation of 243 wards for the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) elections. The party accused BJP of splitting wards in Congress-held constituencies and giving reservations for political advantage. "[BJP] threw social justice to...wind," Congress leader DK Shivakumar said.

30.title: 4 men posing as 'police mitra' rob milk seller of cash in Pune, held
30.article_body: Pune City Police arrested four men for allegedly robbing a 24-year-old milk seller of ₹5,500 in cash after posing as 'police mitra' (friends of police) and threatening to implicate him in a false rape case. The victim had stopped his two-wheeler on the road to receive a phone call when the accused came and snatched his phone, police said.

31.title: Relocate or we'll demolish: BMC in notice regarding 114-yr-old Holy Cross
31.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has issued a public notice regarding a 114-year-old "Holy Cross" near Mumbai's Mahim Creek. In a notice that was sent out on August 1, as per reports, BMC has told the public to relocate the cross in seven days or else it would be demolished by the civic body.

32.title: Bengaluru's CBD, Manyata Tech Park areas to face power cuts today
32.article_body: Central Business District (CBD) and Manyata Tech Park areas in Bengaluru will face power cuts today amid maintenance work by BESCOM. The CBD areas, like Church Street, Residency Road, etc, will see power outages from 10 am to 6 pm. Areas under Manyata Tech Park, like Mariyanapalya, Fathima Layout, etc, will face power cuts from 10 am to 5.30 pm.

33.title: WazirX Co-founder and Binance CEO argue on Twitter over WazirX's ownership
33.article_body: WazirX Co-founder Nischal Shetty responded after Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao tweeted that Binance has never owned shares in Zanmai Labs, the entity operating WazirX. "WazirX was acquired by Binance," Shetty tweeted, adding that Binance has all the crypto assets and profits. Denying Shetty's claims, Zhao said Binance doesn't have control on WazirX's operations, but that WazirX's founding team does.

34.title: PM Modi motivated me when I didn't win medal in Tokyo: Deepak Punia
34.article_body: Following his gold medal in the men's freestyle 86 kg category at CWG 2022, Indian wrestler Deepak Punia said, "PM Narendra Modi motivated me when I didn't get a medal in Tokyo Olympics." "I was...nervous because on August 5, 2021, I lost the bronze medal in the Tokyo Olympics and I was playing on the same date," added Deepak.

35.title: Canada to temporarily ban handgun imports
35.article_body: The Canadian government said it'd temporarily ban imports of handguns from August 19. The ban will last until the national freeze on handguns comes into force, it added. The government had proposed the gun control legislation that put a freeze on importing, buying, or selling handguns in Canada in May. The Canadian Parliament is currently on summer break until September.

36.title: Parts of Chennai to face power cut from 9 am to 2 pm today
36.article_body: Chennai's Anna Salai, Perambur, Ponneri, Tambaram and IT Corridor areas will face a power cut today due to maintenance work, Tamil Nadu Generation and Distribution Corporation said. The power supply in four areas will remain suspended from 9 am to 2 pm, it added. The supply is expected to resume by 2 pm if the work is completed.

37.title: How does the CWG 2022 medal tally read as India jump 2 spots?
37.article_body: India clinched a total of six medals on Day 8 of CWG 2022, including three gold, one silver and two bronze medals. With this, India jumped two spots on the medal standings and are currently on the fifth position. Australia, who have bagged 50 gold medals, are leading the medal standings. Meanwhile, England are second with 47 gold medals.

38.title: Was told 'You're not SRK', now SRK took me in his film: Vijay Varma
38.article_body: Speaking about his struggle days, actor Vijay Varma has revealed that he was told 'Tu Shah Rukh Khan nahi hai (You are not Shah Rukh Khan).' "But now Shah Rukh Khan has employed me for his film," he added. Vijay further said that he figured "even beggars can be choosers" and would refuse to audition for parts he didn't like.

39.title: 23-yr-old man stabbed to death in broad daylight in Pune; 5 held
39.article_body: Five people were arrested after a 23-year-old was stabbed to death in broad daylight in Pune's Kondhwa. The deceased's sister claimed in her complaint that her brother and his friend's vehicle had met with an accident with one of the accused's car on August 1, following which the latter had threatened to murder him. The incident took place on Wednesday.

40.title: Hima Das misses out on CWG final spot by 0.01 seconds after photo finish semi-final
40.article_body: India's 22-year-old sprinter Hima Das missed out on a CWG 2022 final spot in the women’s 200m race after a photo finish semi-final 2. Hima clocked 23.42 seconds, 0.01 seconds less than second-placed Australia's Ella Connolly, who secured automatic qualification to the final along with first-placed Namibia's Christine Mboma from semi-final 2. Hima finished 10th across the three semi-finals.

41.title: India lose to Australia in women's hockey semi-final after controversial penalty shootout
41.article_body: India lost to Australia in penalty shootout in women's hockey semi-finals at CWG 2022. Controversy marred the shootout as the first penalty was ordered to be retaken by officials due to a shot-clock error. Indian goalkeeper Savita Punia had already made a save off the first attempt by Australia. Australia then converted their first three penalties, while India missed all.

42.title: Several women accuse Apple of mishandling sexual harassment complaints: Report
42.article_body: Over a dozen women reportedly accused Apple of mishandling sexual harassment complaints they had raised while working for the company. As per a Financial Times report, 15 current and former employees reported either being retaliated against or getting disappointed by the company. Meanwhile, Apple said it works hard to investigate misconduct complaints and will "make changes to its training".

43.title: Bengaluru reports 1,309 fresh COVID-19 cases, 1 death
43.article_body: Bengaluru reported 1,309 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Friday, according to data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) chief Tushar Giri Nath. The city also recorded one death due to COVID-19, taking the number of total deaths to 16,977. With 8,338 active COVID-19 cases, the positivity rate for last seven days in Bengaluru now stands at 7.61%, data showed.

44.title: Top French scientist posts pic of sausage claiming it's a distant star; apologises later
44.article_body: Top French scientist Étienne Klein has apologised after tweeting a photo of a Spanish sausage, claiming it was an image of a distant star taken by the James Webb Space Telescope. "I feel obliged to specify that this tweet...was a joke," he wrote. Klein said his intention was "to urge caution regarding images that seem to speak for themselves".

45.title: Man caught making video of woman in shower found dead in Noida, 2 held
45.article_body: A 21-year-old man, who was caught making a video of a 19-year-old woman while she was taking a shower, was found dead in Illahabas village in Noida, police said. He was allegedly thrashed by her father and locked in a room after she raised an alarm, police added. Two men were arrested for alleged abetment of suicide, police stated.

46.title: Kim Kardashian and Pete Davidson break up after dating for 9 months: Reports
46.article_body: Kim Kardashian and comedian Pete Davidson have broken up after dating for nine months, reports said. Kim and Pete have "a lot of love and respect for each other", but their schedules "made it really difficult to maintain a relationship", E! News quoted a source as saying. The pair had started dating after Kim's appearance on the 'Saturday Night Live'.

47.title: Thums Up celebrates World Boxing champion Nikhat Zareen
47.article_body: India's boxer Nikhat Zareen reached semi-finals, assuring a medal at Commonwealth Games 2022. On 75 years of India's Independence, Thums Up salutes hands that built India through its #HarHaathToofan campaign. Watch 'Toofani' story of a girl from Nizamabad who lost Olympic tryouts but kept fighting, making India proud by winning World Championship, and has become national treasure, Thums Up said.

48.title: Tool that Musk used to calculate bots on Twitter thought he was a bot, claims Twitter
48.article_body: Twitter has claimed the tool Elon Musk used to calculate the number of bots on Twitter had designated Musk himself as "highly likely" to be a bot. This comes after Musk claimed 10% of accounts on Twitter are bots. Musk cited the number of bots on Twitter as his primary reason for trying to pull out of the $44-billion deal.

49.title: Class 11 student from Gurugram develops financial literacy app 'DhanDanaDan'
49.article_body: Aryan Jain, a Class 11 Gurugram student, has developed a financial literacy app named 'DhanDanaDan' that aims to empower people to manage their finances. The app explains financial planning concepts in a simplified manner in Hindi through animated videos. In 2021, Aryan was the only Indian among the winners of NASA's Artemis Next Gen STEM-Moon to Mars App Development Challenge.

50.title: 22-year-old Mohit Grewal wins India's 6th wrestling medal of the day at CWG 2022
50.article_body: India's 22-year-old wrestler Mohit Grewal won bronze medal in the men's freestyle 125 kg category at CWG 2022. Grewal defeated Jamaica's Aaron Johnson by fall in the bronze medal bout. It was India's sixth wrestling medal on Day 8 of CWG 2022. India have now won 26 medals at CWG 2022, including nine gold, eight silver and nine bronze medals.

51.title: Indian wrestler Divya Kakran wins bout in 26 seconds, bags bronze at CWG 2022
51.article_body: Indian wrestler Divya Kakran on Friday bagged her second consecutive bronze medal at CWG. The 24-year-old won her women's freestyle 68 kg bronze medal bout at CWG 2022 in just 26 seconds, defeating Tiger Lily Cocker Lemalie by fall. India have now won a total of 25 medals at CWG 2022.

52.title: Barcelona fans chant 'Messi, Messi' during Lewandowski's official unveiling
52.article_body: Spanish club Barcelona FC's fans chanted "Messi, Messi" outside the Camp Nou stadium during the official unveiling of the club's latest signing Robert Lewandowski on Friday. Former Barcelona skipper Lionel Messi officially ended his 17-year-long association with the Spanish club on August 5 last year due to monetary issues. Notably, Lewandowski has been signed by Barcelona for €45 million.

53.title: Sikh, Muslim, Dalit outfits to take out march in Jalandhar on eve of I-Day
53.article_body: Sikh, Muslim and Dalit groups will jointly hold a conference on the eve of Independence Day and take out a march in Jalandhar to protest against the "pseudo-nationalism being imposed on Punjab by the Central Government". The activists announced to devise a common strategy to challenge the onslaughts of the "Hindutva government at the Centre" against the minorities.

54.title: Deepak Punia defeats Pakistan's Inam to win India's 3rd gold medal of the day at CWG 2022
54.article_body: Indian wrestler Deepak Punia defeated Pakistan's Muhammad Inam to bag a gold medal in the men's freestyle 86 kg category at CWG 2022. Deepak won the gold medal in his first-ever CWG. India have bagged three gold medals in wrestling at CWG 2022 today. Overall, India have bagged nine gold medals at CWG 2022.

55.title: Aug 5 to be celebrated as 'Bhrashtachar Mukti Diwas' in J&K: LG
55.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Friday said that August 5 will be celebrated as 'Bhrashtachar Mukti Diwas' (corruption-free day). August 5 is the anniversary of the abrogation of Article 370 in Jammu and Kashmir. Sinha made the announcement while launching initiatives for the tribal community. "We're working...to make the development process holistic [and] universal," he said.

56.title: Congress MLA sends Tricolour to Bhagwat, asks him to hoist it at RSS office
56.article_body: Congress MLA and Chhattisgarh Pradesh Congress Committee President Mohan Markam on Friday sent the Tricolour to Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat via courier. Markam requested Bhagwat to hoist the national flag at RSS' headquarters in Nagpur. He claimed the Tricolour hasn't been hoisted at the RSS headquarters in the last 52 years, a statement released by Congress said.

57.title: Nepali minister to visit China from Aug 9 for bilateral talks
57.article_body: Nepali Foreign Minister Narayan Khadka will be on a three-day visit to China starting August 9 to strengthen bilateral ties, officials said. It'll be Nepal's first high-level official visit to Beijing since the formation of PM Sher Bahadur Deuba's government last year. The visit comes as Beijing has stepped up Belt and Road Initiative projects in the region.

58.title: Many hurt as SUV drives through US Native American heritage parade
58.article_body: An SUV drove through a parade celebrating Native American heritage in New Mexico, US, causing injuries to several people, officials said. No casualties were reported, officials said, but Navajo Nation President Jonathan Nez was among the ones who came close to being hit by the car. The driver was taken into police custody and an investigation is on.

59.title: Shelling hits power line at Ukrainian nuclear power plant
59.article_body: A high-voltage power line at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power station, captured by Russian forces, was hit by shelling on Friday, Ukraine confirmed. Ukrainian authorities said that the plant still worked after the strike and no radioactive leak was detected. So far, Ukraine and Russia have blamed each other for the shelling.

60.title: Assailants open fire at RTI activist in Gujarat; shot in head
60.article_body: An RTI activist was seriously injured after a few unknown assailants opened fire and shot at his head in Ankleshwar in Gujarat's Bharuch. The victim, Sadakat Wadiwala (40), is in critical condition as doctors haven't been able to remove the bullet, his wife Afsana said. Notably, the police have booked three suspects and the builders of Ankleshwar's Al Noor complex.

61.title: Pak's Finance Minister warns of 'bad days' amid rising inflation
61.article_body: Pakistan's Finance Minister Miftah Ismail on Friday warned of "bad days" ahead for the country amid depleting foreign reserves. Ismail said that the country would continue to curb imports for the next three months. Last week, New York-based rating agency S&P Global revised Pakistan's long-term ratings from 'stable' to 'negative' due to rising inflation and tighter global financial conditions.

62.title: Your gold medals reflect urge to be the best: Prez Murmu on Punia's CWG gold
62.article_body: Congratulating India's wrestler Bajrang Punia following his gold medal win at the Commonwealth Games 2022, President Droupadi Murmu tweeted, "Your consistency, dedication and excellence are inspirational for our youth." She added, "Your gold medals reflect the urge to be the best, the spirit of the new India." Bajrang won his second straight gold at Commonwealth Games on Friday.

63.title: Felt as close to an international game: Morgan after 47(29) in Hundred game
63.article_body: Former English skipper Eoin Morgan returned to action on Thursday for the first time after retiring from international cricket. "Felt as close to an international game as I have ever felt in the domestic arena, anywhere else apart from India," Morgan said after scoring 47(29) in a Hundred game. He added, "India has the IPL and you have the tension."

64.title: Indian duo of Sathiyan-Sharath reaches table tennis men's doubles CWG semis
64.article_body: Indian pair of Sathiyan Gnanasekaran and Sharath Kamal defeated England's Tom Jarvis and Sam Walker 3-0 to enter the men's doubles semi-final at the Commonwealth Games 2022. They won with a scoreline of 11-6, 11-8, 11-4 in quarter-final on Friday. The Indian duo will play their semi-final on Saturday. Other Indian pair, Harmeet Desai and Sanil Shetty lost in quarter-final.

65.title: Spain reports first acute hepatitis deaths in children
65.article_body: Spain has recorded its first two deaths from acute hepatitis or liver inflammation among children. The Spanish Health Ministry said the country reported 46 cases of hepatitis, and among them, three required liver transplants. The cause of hepatitis is not yet known and some experts speculate it could be caused by a stomach bug.

66.title: Man says 'What could be quieter than a theatre during your movie', Swara responds
66.article_body: Swara Bhasker responded to a man who trolled her over her upcoming film. The man said he's "waiting eagerly for the movie" and added, "Construction work going on...not able to...sleep, what could be quieter than...theatre during your movie!" "Glad...to have given you...chance to land your much practiced and rehearsed joke...Now go show off to...your boys that I replied!" said Swara.

67.title: India responds as Islamic nations' group seeks restoration of J&K's special status
67.article_body: India on Friday criticised the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) over its remarks on the three-year anniversary of the revocation of Article 370 on Friday. OIC's statement "reeks of bigotry", External Affairs Ministry said, adding that it exposes it "as an organisation devoted to a communal agenda being pursued through terrorism". OIC had sought restoration of J&K's special status.

68.title: Conor McGregor to make acting debut in Gyllenhaal's 'Road House': Reports
68.article_body: Irish MMA fighter Conor McGregor has reportedly teamed up with Jake Gyllenhaal for a remake of 1989 cult classic 'Road House'. The film will be directed by Doug Liman, the filmmaker behind films like 'Mr. & Mrs. Smith', 'The Bourne Identity' and 'Edge of Tomorrow', among others. The original film, directed by Rowdy Herrington, featured Patrick Swayze and Sam Elliott.

69.title: Janhvi is so sweet that you cannot hold a grudge against her: Co-star Jaswant
69.article_body: Actor Jaswant Singh Dalal in an interview praised his 'Good Luck Jerry' co-star Janhvi Kapoor, saying that she's an honest actor who knows where she wants to head with her craft. Calling her "very humble and down-to-earth", Jaswant said, "She is so sweet that you cannot hold a grudge against her, you will end up smiling."

70.title: War in Ukraine will cause 40 mn to become food insecure, says US
70.article_body: Russia's invasion of Ukraine will cause 40 million people to become food insecure, US Ambassador to the United Nations Linda Thomas-Greenfield said on Friday. Sub-Saharan Africa will be hardest hit by it, she added. Notably, African countries have largely avoided taking sides in the European conflict and have refused to join Western condemnation and sanctions.

71.title: ASEAN demands cessation of violence in Myanmar
71.article_body: The Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) in a joint statement criticised Myanmar for lack of progress in ending violence in the country. The Myanmar military seized power from elected leader Aung San Suu Kyi in February 2021 and is accused of thousands of extrajudicial killings. ASEAN called for dialogue among all parties in Myanmar and the cessation of violence.

72.title: Biryani party was held to celebrate murder of pharmacist who supported Nupur: NIA
72.article_body: A 'biryani party' was held to celebrate the murder of Maharashtra pharmacist Umesh Kolhe, who was killed in June allegedly for supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma, the NIA has said. Two of those accused of Kolhe's murder had attended the alleged 'party', the agency told a court on Friday. The duo was arrested from Amravati on Wednesday.

73.title: Rishi Sunak wins TV debate against Liz Truss in race to be next UK PM
73.article_body: UK's ex-Finance Minister Rishi Sunak won a TV debate against Foreign Secretary Liz Truss in the leadership contest to elect the new Conservative Party leader and the British PM. The winner of the debate was decided by an audience made up of Conservative Party members. Notably, Sunak needs to win in Conservative Party members' postal ballot to become the PM.

74.title: Binance doesn't own WazirX: Zhao after ED freezes WazirX's bank assets worth ₹65 cr
74.article_body: Changpeng Zhao, the CEO of US-based crypto exchange Binance, said the company doesn't own Indian crypto exchange WazirX, a deal that was understood to be completed back in 2019. "Binance only provides wallet services for WazirX as a tech solution," Zhao wrote. This comes hours after ED said it has frozen bank assets of WazirX worth ₹64.67 crore.

75.title: Indian pair of Sreeja-Sharath enters table tennis mixed doubles semis at CWG
75.article_body: Sreeja Akula and Sharath Kamal reached the mixed doubles semi-final after beating England's Liam Pitchford and Tin-Tin Ho 3-2 at the Commonwealth Games 2022. The Indian duo won with a scoreline of 11-7, 8-11, 11-8, 11-13, 11-9 in the quarter-final on Friday. Sreeja and Sharath will face Australia's Nicholas Lum and Minhyung Jee in the semi-final on Saturday.

76.title: Arpita Mukherjee faces life threat, test her food in jail: ED lawyer
76.article_body: Arpita Mukherjee's advocate pleaded before a court that the aide of ex-Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee should get Division 1 prisoner category as she faces a life threat. Agreeing with this, Enforcement Directorate's advocate said Mukherjee shouldn't be kept with more than four prisoners. The advocate said that food and water should be tested before being served to her in jail.

77.title: Talks on all-party govt moving positively: Lankan Opposition party
77.article_body: Sri Lanka's main Opposition party Samagi Jana Balawegaya on Friday said talks on forming an all-party government were moving positively, with all lawmakers uniting to bring the country out of its economic crisis. President Ranil Wickremesinghe had earlier called for forming an all-party government. Sri Lanka, which declared bankruptcy, has failed to make international debt repayments.

78.title: Wrestler Sakshi Malik wins her 1st CWG gold medal, India's 8th at CWG 2022
78.article_body: Indian wrestler Sakshi Malik won her first CWG gold medal after defeating Ana Godinez Gonzalez of Canada in the women's freestyle 62 kg final at CWG 2022. Overall, it is her third medal in CWG history after her silver at CWG 2014 and bronze at CWG 2018. India have now bagged eight gold medals at CWG 2022 so far.

79.title: He hates music during training, yells at me if I play: CWG medallist Sreeshankar's father
79.article_body: Murali, the father of Murali Sreeshankar who became the first-ever Indian male long jumper to win silver at CWG, said his son doesn't like any kind of music during training. "If I reach out my phone to play something during training he'll yell at me," he said. "He never shies away from hard work. He never finds excuses," he added.

80.title: Uproot inferiority complex to achieve true independence: Amit Shah
80.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday said Indians must uproot the 'inferiority complex' within themselves to achieve 'true independence'. Speaking ahead of India's 76th Independence Day celebrations, Shah said foreign powers ruled India as they succeeded in making native citizens believe they were inferior. "The country that gave Geeta and the Vedas...how can it be illiterate," he asked.

81.title: France going through its most severe drought ever, says PM Borne
81.article_body: France is facing the "most severe drought" ever recorded in the country, French Prime Minister Élisabeth Borne warned in a statement on Friday. Many areas in France are going through a "historic situation" as the country endures its third heatwave this summer, she said. Borne announced the activation of a government crisis unit due to the situation.

82.title: Congress workers and police clash outside Raj Bhawan in Ranchi
82.article_body: A clash broke out between Congress workers and police personnel in Ranchi as several party workers forced their way to Raj Bhawan during their protest march against inflation on Friday. "The Congress workers had permission only to march till Zakir Hussain Park," an official said. "But they pulled down the barricades and reached Raj Bhawan gates," he added.

83.title: Chandigarh Police arrests gangster absconding for last 3 years
83.article_body: Chandigarh Police has arrested an absconding gangster wanted for murder and other cases by the Haryana and UP Police. The accused, Vinit Gahlot, alias Vicky Mitrau, had been absconding for the past three years, police said. Gahlot belongs to the Manjeet Mahal gang and his elder brother Ashok is also a gangster and is presently lodged in jail, police added.

84.title: Snickers maker apologises to China for ad suggesting Taiwan is a country
84.article_body: Mars Wrigley, makers of the Snickers candy bar, apologised for a Snickers product launch which allegedly called Taiwan a country. Videos and pictures of an event promoting a Snickers bar that was said to be only available in the countries of South Korea, Malaysia and Taiwan went viral. Mars Wrigley later said the relevant content had been amended.

85.title: 88% dip in law & order incidents in Kashmir since Aug 2019: Police
85.article_body: Kashmir recorded a decrease of over 88% in law and order incidents in the three years since the erstwhile state's special status was revoked on August 5, 2019, compared to the preceding three years, police said. The Valley saw 3,686 law and order incidents from 2016 to 2019. In three years from August 5, 2019, the Valley recorded 438 incidents.

86.title: Bollywood needs to pull up their socks: Sonu Sood
86.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood has said that South filmmakers have always focused on bringing the audience to the theatres with their extravagant films. When asked if Bollywood needs to pull up their socks, he said, "They need to, I mean everyone needs to...as I think, when you have competition...that's the time you will excel."

87.title: Punjab Governor Banwarilal Purohit tests positive for COVID-19
87.article_body: As per an official statement, Punjab Governor and Administrator of Chandigarh Banwarilal Purohit has tested positive for COVID-19. Purohit is not showing any serious symptoms, the statement said. All those who came in contact with him are requested to isolate, it added. Purohit had also tested positive for the virus in 2020 while he was the Governor of Tamil Nadu.

88.title: Indian wrestler Bajrang Punia wins his 2nd consecutive gold medal at CWG
88.article_body: Indian wrestler Bajrang Punia on Friday bagged his second consecutive gold medal at CWG. The 28-year-old defeated Canada's Lachlan McNeil in the final of the men's freestyle 65 kg category at CWG 2022. Bajrang had defeated Wales' Kane Charig in the final at CWG 2018 to bag his first CWG gold. Bajrang had won a silver medal at CWG 2014.

89.title: Won't pretend to be Shah Rukh Khan's Raj: DDLJ musical's Austin Colby
89.article_body: British actor Austin Colby, who'll play the character based on Shah Rukh Khan's Raj in Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge's Broadway musical adaptation, has responded to criticism around his casting. "I'm aware what my involvement in this production means to...people. I'm not...Raj that Shah Rukh Khan made us fall in love with, nor will I ever pretend to be," Austin said.

90.title: We were detained in undemocratic way, it's not a good sign: Sachin Pilot
90.article_body: Sachin Pilot, along with other Congress leaders, including Priyanka and Rahul Gandhi, was detained in Delhi on Friday for holding protests against inflation and unemployment. On being released after six hours, Pilot said, "The way we're detained in an undemocratic way isn't a good sign." "By fixing the accountability of government, it's our responsibility to question them," he added.

91.title: Indian table tennis player Sathiyan enters men's singles pre-quarters at CWG
91.article_body: Indian paddler Sathiyan Gnanasekaran beat Paul McCreery of Northern Ireland to enter men's singles pre-quarterfinal at Commonwealth Games 2022. Sathiyan won with a scoreline of 11-9, 11-9, 12-10, 13-11 in the round of 32. Meanwhile, Sathiyan and mixed doubles partner Manika Batra lost in the mixed doubles quarter-final. Malaysia's Choong Javen and Lyne Karen defeated the Indian team 3-2.

92.title: Lost jewels found in remains of Spanish ship that sank over 350 years ago
92.article_body: Jewel-encrusted pendants and gold chains are among the priceless artefacts that were found among the remains of a Spanish ship which sank over 350 years ago in the Bahamas. The lost treasure was found recently by Bahamian and US marine archaeologists and divers. They were found among a debris trail spanning over 13 km near the Little Bahama Bank.

93.title: Ashwin-Chahal complement each other; don't see Kuldeep coming in: Sanjay
93.article_body: Former player Sanjay Manjrekar has commented on the combination of spinners Ravichandran Ashwin and Yuzvendra Chahal. "Ashwin focused...on the economy, but when you have...Chahal...then Ashwin becomes a great complement because he has mastered the art of being economical in T20 cricket," Manjrekar said. He added that the combination of Chahal and Kuldeep Yadav will never be "employed" again.

94.title: Lightning strike near White House leaves 2 dead and 2 injured
94.article_body: Two people were killed and two others were injured in a lightning strike in Lafayette Square near the White House, police said on Friday. The lightning struck them on Thursday near a tree that stands yards away from the fence that surrounds the White House, according to Reuters. A thunderstorm had swept through Washington DC earlier in the day.

95.title: 21-year-old Anshu Malik wins silver, India's 1st medal in wrestling at CWG 2022
95.article_body: Wrestler Anshu Malik bagged India's first wrestling medal at the Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022 after clinching silver following her defeat to two-time CWG gold medallist Odunayo Folasade Adekuoroye in the women's freestyle 57 kg event. The 21-year-old was featuring in her first-ever CWG. Anshu had beaten Sri Lanka's Nethmi Poruthotage in the semi-final of the event.

96.title: Russian President Putin hosts Turkish counterpart Erdogan in Sochi
96.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin hosted his Turkish counterpart Recep Erdogan in Sochi on Friday. The war in Ukraine and the situation in Syria were said to be on the agenda. This is the second meeting between the leaders since Turkey supported an agreement between Russia and Ukraine last month to provide a safe sea route to ship trapped grain stocks.

97.title: South Africa reports 1st death causally linked to COVID-19 vaccine
97.article_body: South Africa's health regulator on Thursday said that a causal link has been established between the death of an individual due to neurological disorder Guillain-Barre Syndrome (GBS) and Johnson & Johnson's COVID-19 vaccine. The person developed GBS shortly after taking the vaccine, senior scientists informed. "At the time of illness, no other cause for GBS could be identified," they said.

98.title: J&K logs 823 fresh COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths reported
98.article_body: Jammu & Kashmir reported 823 new cases of COVID-19 on Friday, taking the union territory's active case count to 5,133, officials informed. The union territory also recorded two fatalities due to the infection. According to officials, Jammu division logged 190 cases on Friday, whereas 633 cases were reported from the Kashmir valley.

99.title: Congress protesting in black clothes an insult to Ram Bhakts: UP CM Yogi
99.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath criticised Congress for protesting against the government in black clothes on Ayodhya Diwas and said, "It's an insult to...the Ram Bhakts." He said, "Until now, Congress was protesting in normal attire, but today they protested wearing black clothes...They chose this day [Ayodhya Diwas] which marks the beginning of the construction of Ram Janambhoomi."

100.title: 1 dead, 14 injured after grenade attack in Balochistan's Quetta
100.article_body: A grenade attack on Thursday night in the Balochistan province of Pakistan left at least one person dead and 14 others injured, local media reported on Friday. The incident reportedly occurred when unidentified motorcyclists hurled a grenade at roadside stalls in Quetta's Joint road area. No militant group has claimed responsibility for the attack so far, media reports said.

101.title: Rahul, other Congress leaders released after 6-hr detention in Delhi
101.article_body: Congress leaders including Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi, Shashi Tharoor and KC Venugopal were released from a police station in Delhi after being detained for almost six hours on Friday. They had been detained under Delhi Police Act while protesting against inflation, GST and unemployment. "[We have] been released after being detained...for protesting peacefully," Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said.

102.title: Indian men's team reaches final of 4x400m relay event at CWG 2022
102.article_body: Indian men's relay team of Muhammed Anas Yahiya, Noah Nirmal Tom, Muhammed Ajmal Variyathodi and Amoj Jacob qualified for the 4x400 metres final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Friday. The Indian team finished second in heat two, clocking 3:06.97. Kenya topped the heat, with a timing of 3:06.76. The final will be held on Sunday.

103.title: Israel launches air strikes in Gaza, 5-year-old girl among 7 killed
103.article_body: Israel on Friday said it has launched airstrikes on Gaza, which reportedly killed at least seven people and injured another 40, following heightened tensions in the occupied West Bank. A five-year-old girl was among those killed in the strike, the Palestinian Health Ministry said. An Islamic Jihad group militant named Tayseer Jabari was also among those killed, Israel confirmed.

104.title: Nadal withdraws from Montreal tennis event due to abdominal strain
104.article_body: Former world number one Rafael Nadal has withdrawn from next week's ATP 1000 event in Montreal, Canada due to an ongoing abdominal strain. "I am very sad not to...play a tournament that I have won five times," the 36-year-old Spaniard said. Notably, the same injury forced the 22-time Grand Slam champion to miss his Wimbledon semi-final last month.

105.title: Congress' 'black protest' subtle message against Ram Mandir's construction: Shah
105.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday questioned the choice of Congress leaders to wear black clothes during their protests on the anniversary of PM Narendra Modi laying the foundation stone of Ram Mandir. Shah claimed that the move was a subtle way of conveying Congress' opposition to temple's construction. This was done "to further promote their appeasement politics", he added.

106.title: PV Sindhu reaches her 3rd consecutive women's singles quarters at CWG
106.article_body: Two-time Olympic medallist PV Sindhu reached her third consecutive women's singles quarter-final at the Commonwealth Games in Birmingham on Friday. The 27-year-old Indian shuttler defeated Uganda's Husina Kobugabe 21-10, 21-9 in the round of 16. Sindhu, the last edition's silver medallist in the singles, will face Malaysia's Goh Jin Wei in the quarter-final on Saturday.

107.title: 6 countries interested in buying India's Tejas fighter jets, govt releases list
107.article_body: The government on Friday said that state-owned Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) has offered to sell 18 Tejas fighter jets to Malaysia, adding that six other nations are interested in buying them. Argentina, Australia, Egypt, the United States of America, Indonesia and the Philippines have expressed an interest in buying the light-combat aircraft (LCA), the Defence Ministry said.

108.title: Took dictionary to censor board to explain ch****a isn't gaali: Anurag on Satya
108.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap revealed that he carried a Hindi dictionary to explain a word to the censor board when his 1998 film 'Satya' went for screening. He shared a video that explained how the word 'ch****a' isn't an abusive term, writing, "That's a major truth. During...censor screening of SATYA, I carried...Hindi dictionary to explain the same...that ch****a isn't a gaali."

109.title: Anupam meets Rajamouli in Hyderabad, actor says 'love your simplicity'
109.article_body: Veteran actor Anupam Kher recently met SS Rajamouli and his wife Rama Rajamouli at their residence in Hyderabad. He took to Instagram to thank the 'RRR' director for hosting him for lunch at his place. Anupam also shared a video where he could be seen wrapping a traditional shawl around Rajamouli's shoulders. "I love your simplicity and humility," Anupam wrote.

110.title: Former Pakistan minister spits on live TV during debate, video goes viral
110.article_body: Former Pakistan minister Sheikh Rasheed Ahmad spat during a live television debate, the footage of which has gone viral. This came after Ahmad was asked a question about the current Interior Minister of Pakistan Rana Sanaullah. "His new portfolio should be: minister for spitting on live TV," wrote journalist Naila Inayat while sharing the video.

111.title: Raped by father, 13-yr-old girl delivers baby in Tamil Nadu's Vellore
111.article_body: A 44-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly raping and impregnating his 13-year-old daughter in Tamil Nadu's Vellore district. The matter came to light when the minor complained about stomach ache and was taken to a government hospital. Upon questioning, the girl told police that she had been repeatedly raped by her father for the past 10 months.

112.title: Flash floods killed 550 in Pakistan over past month: Govt agency
112.article_body: Pakistan's National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) on Friday said that flash floods caused by abnormally heavy monsoon rains killed at least 550 people in the country over the past month. The floods had damaged more than 46,200 houses, it added. "We're doing our best to provide for extensive relief and rehabilitation of flood victims," Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif said.

113.title: National-record holder Jyothi fails to qualify for 100m hurdles final at CWG
113.article_body: India's Jyothi Yarraji failed to qualify for the women's 100 metres hurdles final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Friday. The 22-year-old clocked 13.18 seconds to finish fourth in heat two. Jamaica's Megan Tapper topped the heat, clocking 12.68 seconds. Notably, Jyothi is the national record-holder. She clocked 13.04 seconds to set the record.

114.title: South Korea launches its first lunar orbiter
114.article_body: South Korea launched its first lunar orbiter, Korea Pathfinder Lunar Orbiter, nicknamed Danuri, on Friday. The orbiter was launched on SpaceX's Falcon 9 rocket from Florida's Cape Canaveral Space Force Station. It is expected to enter the moon's orbit in December and start a year-long observation mission to search for possible landing sites, conduct research on the lunar environment etc.

115.title: Hoping best players play international cricket as often as they can: ICC CEO
115.article_body: ICC CEO Geoff Allardice said he hopes that the best cricketers often play international cricket. "There'll still be all-format players...whether they play every match...is a different question," Geoff said. He added, "The balance of players playing international cricket versus domestic leagues will continue to evolve." Recently, Ben Stokes retired from ODIs citing an "unsustainable" schedule.

116.title: Ex-Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee, Arpita sent to jail for 14 days
116.article_body: A Kolkata court on Friday sent former Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee and his aide Arpita Mukherjee to a 14-day judicial custody in connection with the West Bengal teacher recruitment scam case. The two will remain in jail till August 18. The Enforcement Directorate's lawyer told the court that the agency needs to interrogate them over new findings in the case.

117.title: Husbands take oath as wives elected to panchayat in MP, probe ordered
117.article_body: A Scheduled Caste woman was recently elected as Sarpanch after elections at Madhya Pradesh's Gaisabad Panchayat, Damoh. Some other women were also elected as panchayat members. A video showed that instead of the women, their husbands and other male relatives allegedly took oath in the swearing-in ceremony. Zila Panchayat CEO Ajay Shrivastava ordered an enquiry after the video went viral.

118.title: I was suicidal at times: Deepika Padukone on battling depression
118.article_body: Deepika Padukone recently talked about the time when she was battling depression. Speaking at an event, she said, "I would break down for no reason...I would sleep because sleep for me was an escape. I was suicidal at times." "Even now when my parents visit me, I always put on a brave front that everything's okay," she added.

119.title: Over 300, including 65 MPs, detained during Congress protest in Delhi
119.article_body: Around 335 people, including 65 Members of Parliament (MPs) were detained in Delhi on Friday, amid Congress' protest against price rise and GST. The detentions were made under the Delhi Police Act, police said, adding, "Intimation about detention...is being sent to the respective competent authorities." Rahul Gandhi, Shashi Tharoor and Priyanka Vadra were among those detained.

120.title: Indian wrestler Bajrang Punia reaches his 3rd final in a row at CWG
120.article_body: Olympic bronze medal-winning Indian wrestler Bajrang Punia has reached his third final in a row in CWG history. The 28-year-old, who bagged silver medal at CWG 2014 and a gold medal at CWG 2018, defeated England's George Ramm in the men's freestyle 65 kg category semi-final at CWG 2022. His gold medal bout will take place later tonight.

121.title: Why is BJP so scared of gas cylinders if there is no inflation: Priyanka
121.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi has criticised the BJP government over the alleged rising inflation. "The...government which charges tax on flour, milk...claims that there is no inflation. Then why is BJP so scared after seeing gas cylinders?" Priyanka said. She added, "Arresting us won't hide the truth as the cylinder which cost ₹410 in 2014 is now priced at ₹1100."

122.title: Sakshi Malik confirms her third CWG medal, to fight for gold tonight
122.article_body: Indian wrestler Sakshi Malik defeated Cameroon's Berthe Emilienne Etane Ngolle in semi-final to reach the final of the women's freestyle 62 kg event at CWG 2022. With this, Sakshi assured herself of her third medal in CWG history. She had bagged silver at CWG 2014 and bronze at CWG 2018. Her gold medal bout will take place later tonight.

123.title: 21-year-old Indian wrestler Anshu Malik reaches gold medal bout on her CWG debut
123.article_body: India's 21-year-old wrestler Anshu Malik has reached the gold medal bout in the women's freestyle 57 kg category on her CWG debut. Anshu defeated Sri Lanka's Nethmi Poruthotage to reach the final. In 2021, Anshu had become the first Indian female wrestler to win silver medal at the World Championships.

124.title: Bird hits Vistara Varanasi-Mumbai flight forcing it to turn around, plane grounded
124.article_body: A Vistara Varanasi-Mumbai flight had to turn around due to a bird hit, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) said on Friday. The UK622 flight, however, made a safe landing in Varanasi, although its radome is damaged, DGCA added. The A320 aircraft has been declared Aircraft on Ground (AOG) on account of the damage.

125.title: It was not for KBC: Amitabh on his 'each time I say never again' post
125.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan has clarified his recent note, 'each time I say never again and yet it all comes back when the commitment has been made', wasn't for his show 'KBC'. "It was for...hair that gets stuck to my face for...films' makeup, and I swear...[I'll] never...do...film with hair stuck to my chin, moustache and yet end up doing it," he added.

126.title: Amazon to acquire robot vacuum cleaner maker iRobot for $1.7 billion
126.article_body: Amazon on Friday said it has signed an agreement to acquire Roomba robot vacuum maker iRobot. The e-commerce giant said it will acquire iRobot for $61 per share in an all-cash transaction valued at approximately $1.7 billion, including iRobot's net debt. On completion of the deal, Colin Angle will remain as CEO of iRobot, Amazon said.

127.title: What an amazing actor, respect: Hrithik on Deepak's performance in 'Good...'
127.article_body: Hrithik Roshan took to Twitter on Thursday to praise Deepak Dobriyal's performance in the recently released movie 'Good Luck Jerry'. "What an amazing actor. Brilliant comic timing and screen presence. Respect," he wrote. Deepak re-shared Hrithik's post on his Instagram handle, writing, "Hrithik Bhai made my decade." 'Good Luck Jerry' also featured Janhvi Kapoor.

128.title: 27-yr-old woman from Kolkata allegedly raped in Noida: Police
128.article_body: A 27-year-old woman from Kolkata was allegedly raped by a man in a hotel in Noida, the police said on Friday. The accused had befriended the victim in a club in Gurugram's Sector 29, the police added. The victim claimed that the accused had threatened to kill her if she disclosed the incident.

129.title: 15,000 litres of liquor seized from Apr-July in GB Nagar: Official
129.article_body: The excise department in Gautam Buddha Nagar seized nearly 15,000 litres of smuggled liquor between April 1 and July 31 this year, a senior official said. The official also said that 164 people were arrested for smuggling the liquor during the same period. Notably, 6,577 litres of liquor was seized during the same period last year.

130.title: Kannada actor, comedian Tennis Krishna enters politics, joins AAP
130.article_body: Kannada actor and comedian Tennis Krishna started his political career by joining the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Thursday. The former tennis coach joined AAP at an event in Bengaluru in the presence of AAP Karnataka Convenor Prithvi Reddy and other leaders. The Twitter page of AAP Bengaluru congratulated him, tweeting, "Hearty welcome." Krishna has acted in around 600 movies.

131.title: 3 corn-laden ships leave Ukraine under grain deal with Russia
131.article_body: Three more ships under the grain export deal signed by Ukraine and Russia departed from Ukrainian ports on Friday, officials confirmed. With over 58,000 tons of corn, the ships are bound for Ireland, the UK and Turkey. The first Ukrainian ship that set sail under the deal earlier this week passed inspection in Istanbul on Wednesday and left for Lebanon.

132.title: Indian shuttler Kidambi reaches men's singles quarter-final at CWG 2022
132.article_body: Indian shuttler Kidambi Srikanth entered the men's singles quarter-final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Friday. The 29-year-old defeated Dumindu Abeywickrama of Sri Lanka 21-9, 21-12 in the round of 16. Srikanth will face England's Toby Penty in the quarter-final on Saturday. Penty beat Scotland's Callum Smith 25-23, 21-12 in the round of 16.

133.title: Man arrested for smuggling foreign cash in thread rolls at Delhi airport
133.article_body: An Indian man was arrested at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International (IGI) airport on Thursday for allegedly trying to smuggle out foreign currency worth ₹42.25 lakhs by concealing it in plastic thread rolls. The accused, who was travelling to Dubai, tied the money around the rolls with black scotch tape, officials said. The officials intercepted him as his activities seemed suspicious.

134.title: US adds 5.28 lakh jobs in July, unemployment rate falls to 3.5%
134.article_body: The US added 5.28 lakh jobs in July with the unemployment rate falling to 3.5%. The report comes days after the US government reported that job vacancies across the country had dropped by 6.05 lakh to 1.07 crore by June-end. The department also revised data for June, showing 3.98 lakh jobs created instead of the previously reported 3.72 lakh.

135.title: Wrestler Sakshi Malik wins her bout within 70 seconds, reaches semi-finals at CWG 2022
135.article_body: Indian wrestler Sakshi Malik won her quarter-final bout in the women's freestyle 62kg event at CWG 2022 within 70 seconds to reach the semi-finals. Sakshi, who had won silver medal at CWG 2014 and bronze medal at CWG 2018, won her bout against Kelsey Barnes by fall. Sakshi will face Cameroon's Berthe Emilienne Etane Ngolle in the semi-final.

136.title: Congress isn't letting the Parliament function: BJP MP Hema Malini
136.article_body: BJP MP Hema Malini refused to comment on the protests staged by the Congress party under their nationwide campaign against rising inflation and unemployment in the country. "I'll not comment on Congress' protests over inflation. Our government, PM Modi and Amit Shah will decide what has to be done," Hema said. "They (Congress) aren't letting the Parliament function," she added.

137.title: Pune bus authority scraps new route diversions following criticism
137.article_body: Pune's public bus service provider scrapped its earlier move to divert long-route buses on Bajirao and Shivaji roads through Deccan and Fergusson College roads. Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) made the decision after commuters said diversions were affecting their schedules. "From August 4, long-distance bus routes will run as per the prior schedules," an official said.

138.title: Rehearsal for Muharram procession with elephant held in Hyderabad
138.article_body: A rehearsal with the elephant for Bibi Ka Alam Muharram procession was held in Hyderabad on Friday by members of the Shia Muslim community. This is considered one of the largest among all religious processions in Hyderabad. "To ensure...the elephant does not panic to loud noise or a sea of the crowd, a rehearsal is done," an organiser said.

139.title: Tulika Maan, who won silver medal, lost 30 kg in a year to take part in CWG 2022
139.article_body: Indian judoka Tulika Maan, who bagged silver at CWG 2022, weighed around 115 kg last year and lost 30 kg in a year to participate at the Games. "When...probables were decided a year ago...she wasn't among the players picked. She brought her weight down to 85 kg...to get into shape. She weighs about 89-90 kg now," coach Jiwan Sharma said.

140.title: India's Manika, Sreeja enter quarters in table tennis event at CWG 2022
140.article_body: India's table tennis players Manika Batra and Sreeja Akula reached the quarter-finals of women's singles at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Friday. Manika defeated Australia's  Minhyung Jee 4-0 in the round of 16, while Sreeja beat Wales' Charlotte Carey 4-3. Meanwhile, Reeth Tennison of India lost to Tianwei Feng of Singapore 1-4.

141.title: 2 men awarded 20-year prison term for gang-rape in Ghaziabad
141.article_body: Two men were awarded 20 years of rigorous imprisonment by a Ghaziabad court on Wednesday after they were found guilty of gang-rape of a 25-year-old healthcare worker on September 22, 2017, near Raj Nagar Extension. The two were also fined ₹50,000 each for the crime. A third suspect was let off as his involvement could not be established, prosecution informed.

142.title: Bumrah, Shami, Bhuvneshwar: Sridhar picks India's pace attack for T20 WC
142.article_body: Speaking about India's possible pace line-up for T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India fielding coach R Sridhar said the top three fast bowlers would be Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammad Shami and Bhuvneshwar Kumar. "Because, if you have this, you have an absolute banker, banker, banker new-ball bowler and death-over bowler in Bhuvi who is in...best shape in terms of his fitness."

143.title: Encounter breaks out in J&K's Kulgam; 1 jawan, 1 civilian injured
143.article_body: An encounter broke out between security forces and terrorists in the Redwani area of J&K's Kulgam district on Friday, police informed. "One Army Jawan and one civilian got injured in the encounter," Kashmir Zone Police tweeted. A cordon and search operation was initially launched after information regarding presence of terrorists in the area was received, an official said.

144.title: Mumbai man cheated out of ₹7.5 lakh in 'sextortion' racket
144.article_body: A 43-year-old man from Mumbai's Chinchpokli has been cheated out of ₹7.5 lakh in an alleged 'sextortion' racket, police said on Friday. The victim recently video chatted with a woman, during which she undressed. Later, a man impersonating a policeman demanded money from the victim, saying the woman had died by suicide after her clip with him was circulated online.

145.title: In a first, Assam awards govt staff for ethics, dedication & punctuality
145.article_body: In a first, Assam government awarded 99 non-gazetted state government employees for their dedication, work ethics and punctuality. The event took place on Friday on the occasion of Lok Kalyan Diwas to mark the death anniversary of Assam's first Chief Minister and Bharat Ratna, Gopinath Bordoloi. The awardees were given a year's extension of service with ₹25,000 and a citation.

146.title: Leopard electrocuted to death at a tiger reserve in MP's Sidhi
146.article_body: A leopard was electrocuted to death in Madhya Pradesh's Sanjay Dubri Tiger Reserve, according to wildlife officials. "The animal had died hours before the carcass was spotted on Friday morning...Locals may have also played a part, we are finding out the details," an official said. In June, two leopards were electrocuted at a wildlife zone in Madhya Pradesh's Satna.

147.title: Crypto exchange WazirX's bank assets worth ₹65 crore frozen by ED
147.article_body: ED has frozen bank assets worth ₹64.67 crore of Indian cryptocurrency exchange WazirX following a search on the premises of its Director Sameer Mhatre. ED said the action is for "assisting accused instant loan app companies in laundering fraud money via purchase and transfer of virtual crypto assets". The government earlier said ED is probing WazirX transactions worth ₹2,790 crore.

148.title: Noida doctor gets warning after a patient she refused to see dies
148.article_body: A female doctor of the District Hospital in Noida Sector 30 has been issued a warning for not seeing a patient on Thursday who later died due to health complications, an official informed. The patient was however attended by other doctors, he added. The deceased's relatives alleged that the doctor refused to see the patient as "he was a male".

149.title: Ambulance driver held for assaulting woman at Hyd's Osmania Hospital
149.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Friday arrested 35-year-old Mohd Arif, an ambulance driver, for allegedly threatening and physically assaulting a woman at Osmania General Hospital. Two days ago, Arif allegedly assaulted 27-year-old Begum after an argument at the hospital premises. "Arif who was seated on a chair stood up and charged towards Begum and repeatedly slapped and pushed her," police said.

150.title: School kids ferried on tractor after cars get stuck due to rain in Bengaluru
150.article_body: A video circulating on social media shows students boarding a tractor to go to their school in Bengaluru. The residents of Rainbow Drive Layout on Sarjapur Road had reportedly hired two tractors after their respective cars, parked in the basement, got stuck due to rainfall-induced waterlogging. The residents alleged that no municipal official had come to clear the flood.

151.title: Ranbir's film with Luv delayed, actor to resume shoot after 'Animal': Reports
151.article_body: Filmmaker Luv Ranjan's upcoming film starring Ranbir Kapoor and Shraddha Kapoor will reportedly be delayed due to the fire incident that took place on the set of the film in Mumbai last week. According to reports, Ranbir will resume shooting for Luv's yet-untitled film after completing Sandeep Reddy Vanga's 'Animal'. Luv's film will also feature Dimple Kapadia.

152.title: Why is Cong scared of investigating agencies: Thakur amid protests
152.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur criticised the Congress for protesting against questioning of the party leaders in the National Herald case and asked why the Congress is scared of investigating agencies. "Putting pressure on these agencies is not fair. They're only doing their work," Anurag Thakur said. "Sonia ji and Rahul ji, please don't play such games," Thakur added.

153.title: 4 NLFT militants surrender along with weapons in Tripura
153.article_body: Four militants of National Liberation Front of Tripura (NLFT) and two of their collaborators surrendered before the police on Friday, an official said. They surrendered one AK-47 rifle with two magazines, two pistols with three magazines and a notebook containing extortion notices, the official added. The militants led by Umesh Koloi reportedly entered Tripura from Bangladesh on July 21.

154.title: 40-year-old Sharath Kamal defeats 23 years younger opponent, reaches pre-quarterfinals
154.article_body: India's 40-year-old table tennis player Sharath Kamal, who had bagged men's singles gold at CWG 2006, defeated 17-year-old Finn Luu of Australia to reach the pre-quarterfinals at CWG 2022. Sharath Kamal won the match with a scoreline of 12-10, 11-8, 11-7, 11-6. Earlier at the ongoing Games, Sharath Kamal bagged the men's team gold medal.

155.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
155.article_body: Isolated very heavy rainfall is likely over Karnataka on August 5 and 6, Tamil Nadu and Kerala on August 5, Telangana during August 5-9 and Andhra Pradesh on August 8 and 9. Rainfall is also likely over Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Gujarat, Maharashtra and Goa. Odisha and Rajasthan are also likely to experience very heavy rainfall between August 7-9.

156.title: 5 poachers arrested from wildlife sanctuary in Odisha's Bargarh
156.article_body: Five suspected poachers were arrested from Debrigarh Wildlife Sanctuary in Odisha's Bargarh on Friday, a forest official said. The poachers entered the wildlife sanctuary to hunt sambar deer and bison for their horns and skin, the official added. Acting on a tip-off, an 18-member patrol team apprehended the suspects and seized a sambar horn, an axe, wire traps and motorcycles.

157.title: Congratulations on your gold medal: Anurag Thakur to para powerlifter Sudhir
157.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur took to Twitter following Indian para powerlifter Sudhir's gold medal in men's heavyweight category at CWG 2022 and wrote, "Congratulations on your gold medal at your first CWG." He added, "With the display of skill and spirit on...mat today you showed the world what champions are made of." Notably, the 27-year-old set a CWG record.

158.title: Video shows Priyanka being dragged into police van amid protest in Delhi
158.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra was detained by Delhi Police as she and other party members protested against unemployment and inflation outside Congress headquarters on Friday. A video showed five to six female constables dragging Priyanka and lifting her into a police vehicle. Earlier, she was seen jumping over a police barricade to participate in the protest.

159.title: Man carrying ₹112 cr heroin on Delhi-bound train arrested in B'luru
159.article_body: A man carrying 16 kg of heroin worth ₹112 crore was arrested in a train that was bound to leave for Delhi from Bengaluru railway station. Officers of the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence found the drugs concealed in a false cavity inside his trolley bag. The 35-year-old man, believed to be from Tamil Nadu, had arrived in Bengaluru from Ethiopia.

160.title: Germany's Health Minister tests positive for coronavirus
160.article_body: German Health Minister Karl Lauterbach has tested positive for coronavirus, the German Health Ministry announced on Friday. "The minister is fine, he has only mild symptoms. He is temporarily conducting his official duties from home isolation," it said. Lauterbach is an epidemiologist by training who has led Germany's fight against COVID-19 since December.

161.title: Ex-Mumbai Police Commissioner denied bail in NSE phone tapping case
161.article_body: Former Commissioner of Mumbai Police Sanjay Pandey's bail application in a money laundering case has been denied by a special court in Delhi. Judge Sunena Sharma said prima facie evidence showed Pandey was involved in snooping on employees of the National Stock Exchange (NSE). The Enforcement Directorate arrested Pandey on July 19 and he is currently in judicial custody.

162.title: Police probe severe thrashing of 2 dogs in Pune last month
162.article_body: Pune City Police has launched an investigation into the severe beating of two dogs in the city's Wagholi area last month. According to the FIR filed by an animal activist, an unidentified man thrashed the dogs near Panchshil Towers Society on July 22. Sections under the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act, 1960, have been invoked in the case.

163.title: No trees cut for metro shed in Aarey, only branches trimmed: MMRCL
163.article_body: Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation Limited (MMRCL) told Supreme Court that no trees have been cut for the construction of a metro car shed in Mumbai's Aarey Forest area since 2019. MMRCL also assured that no trees in the area would be cut until the next hearing, dated August 10. Only some bushes and branches have been trimmed, MMRCL added.

164.title: War in Ukraine can't be ended by ignoring Russia: Turkey
164.article_body: The international community cannot end the war in Ukraine by ignoring Russia, a top aide to Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said. "The truth is that some of our friends don't want the war to end. They're shedding crocodile tears," Fahrettin Altun added. Turkey has been mediating between Moscow and Kyiv since the beginning of the ongoing war.

165.title: Rupee closes higher by 17 paise at 79.23 against US dollar
165.article_body: The rupee rose by 17 paise to close at 79.23 (provisional) against the US dollar on Friday from its previous close of 79.40 after the Reserve Bank of India increased the repo rate by 50 basis points to 5.40%. The rupee was boosted by foreign fund inflows into capital markets and softening crude oil prices, forex traders said.

166.title: India's para TT players Alagar, Sonalben to fight for bronze at CWG on Saturday
166.article_body: Indian para table tennis players Raj Aravindan Alagar and Sonalben Manubhai Patel lost in their respective semi-finals at CWG 2022 on Friday. Alagar lost to Nigeria's Nasiru Sule 1-3 in men's singles classes 3-5, while Sonalben lost to Nigeria's Ifechukwude Christiana Ikpeoyi 1-3 in women's singles classes 3-5. Both Alagar and Sonalben will play for the bronze medal on Saturday.

167.title: Pune man involved in father-son duo's murder arrested from Beed
167.article_body: Police have arrested a man identified as Ketan Kolte (28) from Beed for his alleged involvement in the murder of a father-son duo that took place in Pune seven months back. Police have also arrested eight others in the case. The accused reportedly attacked the victims while they were travelling in a car following a fallout from a previous dispute.

168.title: Not putting Batgirl out unless we believe in it: Warner Bros Discovery CEO
168.article_body: After the movie 'Batgirl' got cancelled, Warner Bros Discovery CEO, David Zaslav, said that the broadcasting company is going to focus on quality. "We're not going to launch a movie until it's ready, we're not going to go to movie to make a quarter, and we're not going to put the movie out unless we believe in it," he added.

169.title: Was bullied online for gaining weight, it was so surprising: Harnaaz Sandhu
169.article_body: Miss Universe Harnaaz Sandhu revealed that she has "kind of grown physically and got more pounds" since being crowned in December, adding that she's "totally comfortable" with it. However, the 22-year-old added that she was bullied online for gaining weight. "It was kind of uncomfortable and really surprising...to see how people started having...opinions, which shouldn't really matter," she said.

170.title: Assam delegation to visit Mizoram to discuss border dispute
170.article_body: A five-member delegation headed by Assam Border Protection and Development Minister Atul Bora will be on a two-day visit to Mizoram from August 9 to discuss the border dispute with the neighbouring state. Meanwhile, Mizoram Home Minister Lalchamliana will lead his side of the team. Many conflicts have taken place between both the states in the last few years.

171.title: BSF arrests Pakistani fisherman off Gujarat coast, seizes 5 boats
171.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) on Friday arrested one Pakistani fisherman and seized five boats from Harami Nala creek area in Gujarat's Kutch district. During patrolling, the BSF troops observed movement of some fishing boats near the India-Pakistan border early today. While other fishermen escaped successfully, the BSF managed to arrest one Pakistani national, a release by the BSF said.

172.title: Titan's Q1 profit surges 1,200% to ₹793 crore, revenue up by 176%
172.article_body: Titan Company on Friday reported a 1,200% year-on-year growth in its standalone profit after tax at ₹793 crore in the quarter ended June as against ₹61 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. Its standalone revenue rose by 176% to ₹8,961 crore as compared to ₹3,249 crore year-on-year. Titan's shares were trading at ₹2,445.2 on the NSE on Friday.

173.title: Wrestling venue at CWG 2022 emptied due to security alert
173.article_body: The venue for wrestling events at CWG 2022 has been emptied in Birmingham due to security alert. "We're taking a short pause for a safety check and will resume action once we receive the go-ahead," United World Wrestling tweeted. As many as nine matches had already been completed before the events were paused.
