349.article_body: Indian shuttler Aakarshi Kashyap has reached the women's singles pre-quarterfinals at CWG 2022 after emerging winner of her round of 32 match against Pakistan's Mahoor Shahzad. Aakarshi won the first game 22-20 and was leading 8-1 in the second when Mahoor retired due to an injury. PV Sindhu and Kidambi Srikanth also reached women's singles and men's singles pre-quarterfinals, respectively.

350.title: US, EU, Iran restart Tehran nuclear talks in Vienna
350.article_body: Representatives from Iran, the US and European Union restarted talks over Tehran's nuclear deal on Thursday, as reports claimed the Islamic Republic was expanding uranium enrichment. The Vienna talks are taking place amid growing skepticism, with the EU warning "space for additional significant compromises has been exhausted". The US is not directly communicating with Iran, but through the EU.

351.title: Canada sending military personnel to UK to train Ukrainians
351.article_body: Canadian Defence Minister Anita Anand said the country's military trainers are going to the UK to teach Ukrainians on how to defend against invading Russian forces. As per plans, 225 Canadian Armed Forces personnel will be based in the UK for at least four months. The Canadians will work alongside counterparts from Britain, New Zealand and the Netherlands.

352.title: Gandhi family's record is corrupt, Sonia & Rahul are out on bail: BJP
352.article_body: Amid the National Herald money laundering case, BJP national spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia said on Thursday, "The Gandhi family’s track record is corrupt." "Three members of the family, Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi and Robert Vadra, are out on bail," he added. He alleged that assets worth ₹2,000 crore of Associated Journals Limited were transferred to Young Indian.

353.title: Snakebite victim's brother visits UP for funeral, gets bitten by snake
353.article_body: A 22-year-old man named Govind Mishara travelled from Ludhiana to Uttar Pradesh's Bhawanipur village to attend the last rites of his brother who had died of snakebite on Tuesday. During his visit, Govind died after he himself got being bitten by a snake in his sleep. One of his relatives, who was in the same house, was also bitten.

354.title: Measures like scrapping Article 370 helped J&K's tourism sector: Reddy
354.article_body: Union Minister G Kishan Reddy on Thursday said Jammu and Kashmir reported "record footfall" of tourists in recent months because of "transformative initiatives" like abrogating Article 370. The comments came a day before the third anniversary of the revocation of Jammu and Kashmir's special status. Reddy said over 79 lakh tourists visited the state between October 2021 and March 2022.

355.title: 72-ft tricolour installed in Mussoorie for 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign
355.article_body: The Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) installed a 72-feet-tall national flag at ITBP Academy in Mussoorie, in association with Flag Foundation of India. The installation was done to spread awareness for the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign and is dedicated to the martyrs of the freedom struggle. The 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign is a part of the 76th Independence Day celebrations.

356.title: Johnny Depp drugged me the first time we had sex, claims his ex-girlfriend Ellen Barkin
356.article_body: Newly unsealed court documents reportedly reveal that Johnny Depp's ex-girlfriend, actress Ellen Barkin claimed he was "controlling", drank too much red wine and gave her a quaalude drug the first time they had sex. "He gave me a quaalude and asked...if I wanted to f**k," she was quoted as saying. Ellen was introduced as a witness by Amber Heard's team.

357.title: Fabrication Bazar raises ₹7 crore in a seed funding round
357.article_body: Fabrication Bazar, an engineering startup for manufacturing sectors, has raised ₹7 crore in a seed funding round. The round was led by Inflection Point Ventures, and the funds will be used to expand the team and scale operations to the export market. Founded in 2016 by Dwaipayan Dutta and Mohit Garg, Fabrication Bazar manufactures prefabricated steel products.

358.title: Reliance-backed logistics arm of Dunzo joins ONDC
358.article_body: Reliance-backed Dunzo for Business (D4B), the logistics arm of Dunzo, has joined the Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC) for last mile-delivery services. D4B said that the partnership will help local businesses. Dalvir Suri, D4B's head and Dunzo Co-founder said that they will start with key metros and later expand to other cities.

359.title: Do not overreact, no reason to escalate tensions: US to China over Pelosi's Taiwan visit
359.article_body: After China deployed planes and fired live missiles near Taiwan, the US urged China not to overreact to US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan. "There's no reason to react the way that they have or to escalate the tensions," White House national security spokesperson John Kirby said. "Bring down the tensions and work through this," he added.

360.title: Hardik Pandya visits former MI teammate Pollard's house in Caribbean, shares pics
360.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya visited his former MI teammate Kieron Pollard's house in the Caribbean. Sharing pictures, he wrote, "No trip to the Caribbean is complete without a visit to the King's home...Polly my favourite and your beautiful family, thank you for hosting me my brother." India are currently playing a five-match T20I series against West Indies.

361.title: 1 migrant labourer killed, 2 injured in grenade attack by terrorists in Pulwama
361.article_body: A migrant labourer died and two others were injured after terrorists hurled a grenade in Gadoora area of Pulwama in Jammu and Kashmir on Thursday. The area has been cordoned off and efforts have been launched to nab the terrorists, said Jammu and Kashmir Police. Both the injured labourers are now stable.

362.title: 73-year-old SP leader Azam Khan admitted to ICU with pneumonia
362.article_body: Senior Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan has been admitted to an ICU of Medanta hospital in Lucknow. The 73-year-old leader, who complained of breathlessness, was found suffering from pneumonia on Wednesday. "[He] has been kept under observation of a critical care team. His condition is stable," a doctor said. SP chief Akhilesh Yadav paid him a visit in the hospital.

363.title: Drugs, ₹2 cr cash recovered in J&K's Udhampur, 1 arrested
363.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir Police have recovered narcotics and cash in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur, officials said. The police have arrested one person in connection to the case and recovered 250 gm of heroin and cash of nearly ₹2 crore in different denominations. A case has been registered under relevant sections and an investigation has been initiated.

364.title: Video of Nikhat wishing her mother on b'day after assuring India of CWG medal goes viral
364.article_body: A video of Indian boxer Nikhat Zareen wishing her mother happy birthday after winning her quarter-final bout and assuring India of a medal at CWG 2022 has gone viral. In the video, Nikhat, who can be seen leaving the boxing ring, says, "Happy birthday ammi...I love you. Allah aapko khush rakhe." Nikhat's semi-final will take place on Saturday.

365.title: Lightning strikes kill 3 in separate incidents in Telangana
365.article_body: Three persons died in lightning strikes amid heavy rains in separate incidents in Telangana's Jayashankar Bhupalpally district. Vanga Ravi, a 48-year-old farmer, died in his farm in Ponugondla village and another farmer, 25-year-old Katam Raghupathi Reddy, was struck by lightning in  Shatrajpally village. Arepalli Varamma, a 56-year-old farmer, was struck by a lightning in Gopalapuram village.

366.title: Ranveer-Alia are this generation's SRK-Kajol: Karan Johar
366.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt are the present generation's Shah Rukh Khan and Kajol. "When Ranveer and Alia face the camera, you'll see...chemistry because they're buddies, they're friends," Karan said. "That friendship results in chemistry," he added. Alia and Ranveer will be next seen together in 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani', helmed by Karan himself.

367.title: Security forces arrest three militants in J&K's Kupwara
367.article_body: In Jammu and Kashmir's Kupwara district, security forces arrested three militants and recovered arms and ammunition from their possession, the police said. The trio tried to flee a checkpoint at Fruit Mandi Crossing in Handwara, and were arrested, a police spokesperson said. Two of the arrested were identified as Manzoor Ahmed Kumar and Showkat Ahmed Bhat.

368.title: Life expectancy rose by 10 years in Africa from 2000 to 2019: WHO
368.article_body: Africa's healthy life expectancy rose by 10 years from the estimates of 2000 to 2019, the World Health Organization said on Thursday. This is the highest growth in life expectancy in any part of the world for this period. Life expectancy in Africa was 46 years in 2000 and in 2019 it was 56 years, according to WHO Africa.

369.title: NZ MPs urged to delete TikTok over fears China may access data
369.article_body: Members of the New Zealand Parliament have been urged to delete TikTok on their parliamentary phones as it poses a security risk, reports stated. "The parliamentary service strongly recommends you don't use TikTok on your parliamentary service devices as....data on your devices could be accessed by ByteDance [TikTok's owner] and the Chinese government," a parliamentary directive reportedly read.

370.title: Haryana Police arrest illegal arms manufacturer, seize country-made pistols
370.article_body: Haryana Police on Thursday arrested a man from Rajasthan's Bharatpur, who was allegedly involved in manufacturing and selling illegal weapons, a police spokesperson said. At least 48 country-made pistols, 17 cartridges and material used in making weapons were recovered from him. "Apart from making new weapons, he used to repair the old ones for a long time," the spokesperson added.

371.title: Delhi sees over 2,000 new COVID cases for 2nd straight day, positivity rate at 11.84%
371.article_body: Delhi reported 2,202 new COVID-19 cases on Thursday, compared to 2,073 cases recorded the previous day. The city also reported four deaths due to the infection, while the positivity rate rose to 11.84%. This is for the fourth day in a row that the national capital's COVID-19 positivity rate has crossed the 10% mark.

372.title: Ranveer Singh invited to pose nude again for PETA campaign
372.article_body: After Ranveer Singh's nude photoshoot went viral, People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals (PETA) India wrote a letter, inviting him to do a similar photoshoot for them. The organisation requested Ranveer to promote veganism through their campaign. It cited an example of Pamela Anderson, who earlier posed for PETA's 'All Animals Have the Same Parts - Try Vegan' campaign.

373.title: Gujarat leaders Raju Parmar, Naresh Raval quit Congress, to join BJP
373.article_body: Senior Congress leaders from Gujarat, Naresh Raval and Raju Parmar, resigned from the party on Thursday. "We'll join BJP...on August 17," Raval said, adding, "Many of our supporters will also join the BJP on that day." Further, Raval said that he has had many bitter experiences in Congress in the last ten years. This comes ahead of Gujarat Assembly elections.

374.title: Wife, mother of a lawyer shot dead by 4 persons in Haryana's Hansi
374.article_body: The wife and mother of a lawyer, Bunty Yadav, were shot dead on Thursday at his residence in Haryana's Hansi by four unidentified people, police said. The deceased have been identified as 27-year-old Supriya and 62-year-old Geeta Yadav, Bunty Yadav's wife and mother respectively. Bunty Yadav saved his life by locking himself in a room, police added.

375.title: 45 elephants killed in train accidents between 2019 & 2021: Govt
375.article_body: Union Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw in a written reply to a Lok Sabha MP said that 45 elephants were killed in train accidents between 2019 and 2021. Providing statistics of deaths of elephants under different railway zones, Vaishnaw stated, in 2019, 10 elephants were killed and in 2020, 16 elephants died in collision with trains. In 2021,19 elephants were killed.

376.title: Brittney Griner found guilty on drug charges by Russian court, gets 9 years in prison
376.article_body: A Russian court has sentenced US basketball star Brittney Griner to nine years in prison after finding her guilty of deliberately bringing cannabis-infused vape cartridges into Russia despite them being illegal. This comes after a month-long trial and nearly six months after she was arrested at a Moscow-area airport. Griner's time served, since February, will be included in her term.

377.title: IFS officer shares pic of clouded leopard, calls it 'rare beauty'
377.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan took to Twitter to share a picture of a clouded leopard on the occasion of International Clouded Leopard Day. Calling clouded leopard a "rare beauty", Kaswan stated that the picture was taken at the Buxa Tiger Reserve. "Do you know where else we can find them in India?" he further asked his followers.

378.title: I read Irrfan's medical files & think 'Did I do something wrong?': Sutapa
378.article_body: Irrfan Khan's wife Sutapa said she hasn't been able to part ways with the actor's medical files even two years after his death. "I can't let those medical files go. Every night I...read them...thinking 'Did I do something wrong?'" Sutapa said. She said Irrfan was initially reluctant toward chemotherapy and wanted to live holistic life to deal with his illness.

379.title: Shiv Sena leader booked for using defamatory words against Maha CM
379.article_body: Kavita Gavand, a leader of Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena faction, has been booked for using defamatory language against Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde. According to police, Gavand used inappropriate words on Tuesday while supporters of Thackeray and Shinde clashed with each other over the installation of the photo frame of the CM and his son at Shiv Sena office in Dombivli.

380.title: We have ₹10 lakh cr proposals: Raj govt ahead of investment summit
380.article_body: The Rajasthan government on Thursday said it has arranged investment proposals worth over ₹10 lakh crore covering multiple sectors ahead of the 'Invest Rajasthan 2022’ Summit. Minister Shakuntala Rawat said around 3,000 delegates will attend the event and sessions will be held on start-ups, agriculture and future-ready sectors. The summit will be held on October 7 and 8 in Jaipur.

381.title: Ukraine’s situation not feasible for our students to go back: Govt
381.article_body: The Centre on Thursday said that Ukraine’s ground situation doesn’t permit the return of Indian students to the country. "We have been in touch with educational authorities in Ukraine…[They have] essentially reiterated [their] willingness to continue online courses,” the Centre told the Rajya Sabha. These students can appear in the Foreign Medical Graduate Examination, the government further said.

382.title: 300-year-old sculptures worth crores recovered from deceased smuggler's house in Chennai
382.article_body: Tamil Nadu Idol Wing CID recovered nine stolen sculptures from a house in Broadway in Chennai. The idols, believed to be nearly 300 years old, are estimated to be worth crores of rupees. The house belonged to Pamela Emanuel, wife of late Manuel Pineiro, who was reportedly an idol smuggler. Manuel's family didn't have proper documentation for statues, police said.

383.title: Nisha is dating a man who posed as his 'rakhi brother': Karan Mehra
383.article_body: Actor Karan Mehra has accused his estranged wife Nisha Rawal of having an extramarital affair with a man named Rohit Satia, who posed as her 'rakhi brother' and also performed her 'kanyadaan'. "He's staying at my house with Nisha," Karan said, adding that his son also stays with them, which is morally questionable. Karan claimed Rohit had "physically assaulted" him.

384.title: SEBI seeks clarification from Zomato over 'Eternal' restructuring
384.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has asked food delivery company Zomato to issue a clarification regarding the 'Eternal' restructuring scheme. CEO Deepinder Goyal in an internal memo said that the company will have multiple CEOs running the different businesses - Zomato, Blinkit, Hyperpure and Feeding India. He further added that the larger organisation would be called 'Eternal'.

385.title: It's fake, says Andhra MP as alleged nude video call with woman goes viral
385.article_body: YSRCP MP Gorantla Madhav has filed a complaint claiming that leaders of Telugu Desam Party (TDP) had morphed his face into a nude video to taint his image. The video, which he claims is "morphed", allegedly shows him having a video call with an unidentified woman. TDP leaders alleged that the MP had sexually harassed the woman in the video.

386.title: CBI raids Odisha businessman Mahimananda's office in ₹25 lakh bribe case
386.article_body: CBI raided the residence and office of Odisha businessman Mahimananda Mishra on Thursday in connection with a bribery case. As per reports, a senior official of Paradip Port Authority is accused of accepting over ₹25 lakh bribe to approve a project to be implemented at the port by Mishra's Odisha Stevedores Limited. Mishra is among the wealthiest persons in Odisha.

387.title: A-listers refused to work with me as I didn't compromise: Mallika Sherawat
387.article_body: Actress Mallika Sherawat said A-list actors refused to work with her as she wouldn't compromise. "If the hero calls you at 3 am and says, 'Come to my house', you have to go...if you are doing that film. If you don't go, you are out of the film," she told Bollywood Hungama. Mallika added she refused to "bow down".

388.title: 'Modishahi' reaching a new low: Cong on Kharge's summoning by ED
388.article_body: Congress on Thursday said that Mallikarjun Kharge's summoning by the ED during the working hours of Parliament was an "insult" to the legislature, alleging that "Modishahi" is reaching a new low. Congress's Digvijaya Singh said that the summoning of the Leader of Opposition in RS by a probe agency during Parliamentary proceedings had never happened in the history of democracy.

389.title: I've never liked living in Hollywood, it's frustrating: Sam Neill
389.article_body: Actor Sam Neill, who took a short break from acting and moved to his farm in New Zealand, said he doesn’t like to stay in Hollywood. “I really like working there...But it’s not a place where I want to live,” Neill said. “What I found frustrating about Hollywood...is that the only thing...people are interested in is...show business,” he said.

390.title: Jadeja deletes his viral comment on CSK's '10 years of Jaddu' tweet, sparks rift rumours
390.article_body: All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has deleted his viral comment on CSK's '10 years of Jaddu' tweet that was posted by the franchise on February 4, sparking rumours of rift. Jadeja, who had joined the franchise in 2012, had commented, "10 more to go." Earlier, Jadeja had also deleted CSK-related posts from his Instagram account. However, CSK has constantly rubbished rift rumours.

391.title: Sonia, Rahul Gandhi not above law, Cong trying to spread anarchy: BJP
391.article_body: The BJP on Thursday accused Congress of trying to spread "anarchy" and "abusing and intimidating" the ED amid the Opposition party's protests against the agency's action against its leaders in the National Herald case. "Congress leaders are abusing and threatening the investigation agency. Sonia Gandhi and Rahul should know that they are not above the law," BJP's Gaurav Bhatia said.

392.title: UP couple who kidnapped 3-month-old baby arrested, infant rescued
392.article_body: A couple from Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr was arrested and the three-month-old baby they had kidnapped on Tuesday was rescued, police said on Thursday. The couple wanted to take the infant to Kolkata to sell it to a needy person. The woman is a Bangladeshi national, a habitual offender and has been married several times, said SSP Manjunath TC.

393.title: Judiciary should 'walk the talk': Mufti after journalist denied bail
393.article_body: Former J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti on Thursday said the judiciary should "walk the talk", as journalist Siddique Kappan was denied bail by the Allahabad High Court. Siddique Kappan was once again denied bail and continues to be behind bars for covering the Hathras gang rape case, she said. Kappan has been booked under UAPA and on charges of sedition.

394.title: Maha ATS arrests Dawood Ibrahim's associate in terror funding case
394.article_body: The Maharashtra Anti Terrorism Squad has arrested an associate of fugitive gangster Dawood Ibrahim in a terror funding case. Parvez Zuber Vaid Memon, who is allegedly involved in "anti-national activities", was picked up from his home in suburban Versova, an official said. The FIR in the matter has also named Dawood's younger brother Anees Ibrahim.

395.title: Over 4,000 cattle die of lumpy skin disease in Rajasthan
395.article_body: Over 4,000 animals, mostly cows, have been killed and another 90,000 were infected by the lumpy skin disease in Rajasthan. Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Thursday appealed to herders to contact veterinary centres if they see signs of the viral disease. "The infection has spread to 16 districts. Barmer, Jodhpur and Jalore are the worst affected," said a senior official.

396.title: Guj doctor fakes kidnapping to exact ₹15 lakh from father to pay gambling debt
396.article_body: A 33-year-old doctor was detained in Ahmedabad on Wednesday for allegedly faking a kidnapping to exact ₹15 lakh in ransom from his father and clear debts he incurred through online gambling. The doctor had also borrowed ₹26.5 lakh from friends after losing money through online gambling. He drove around Ahmedabad in his car while calling his father with ransom demands.

397.title: Fire breaks out in Berlin forest after blast at bomb disposal site
397.article_body: An explosion at a police munitions detonation site in Berlin started a forest fire in the German capital's Grunewald area on Thursday. Officials said there was possibility of more explosions and flying debris from the site. Firefighting efforts were impeded as personnel were forced to maintain a safety distance of 1 km from the flames.

398.title: Actress Upasana Singh sues Harnaaz Sandhu for allegedly breaching film contract
398.article_body: Miss Universe Harnaaz Sandhu, who's set to make her debut in the entertainment industry with Punjabi film 'Bai Ji Kuttange', has been sued by actress-producer Upasana Singh for allegedly not honouring a contract. Upasana claimed that Harnaaz has refused to give dates for the film's promotion despite having signed agreement to make herself available in person and virtually for it.

399.title: Iranian satellite to be launched into orbit by Russian space agency
399.article_body: Russia will place an Iranian remote sensing satellite into orbit on August 9, the Roscosmos space agency said on Wednesday. The announcement of the launch comes weeks after Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit to Iran, during which he met Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi and the country's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. Notably, both Russia and Iran are under US sanctions.

400.title: India beat Wales 4-1, reach men's hockey semi-finals at CWG for 4th consecutive time
400.article_body: India defeated Wales 4-1 in their final men's hockey group match to advance to the semi-finals at CWG 2022. India topped Pool B with three victories and a draw. It is the fourth consecutive time that India have reached the men's hockey semi-finals at CWG. Harmanpreet Singh netted a hat-trick in India's 4-1 victory over Wales.

401.title: Bihar SP gets show-cause notice for not producing accused in court in 42-yr-old case
401.article_body: A Bihar sessions court issued Rohtas police superintendent Ashish Bharti a show-cause notice for not producing an accused in a 42-year-old murder case. Calling the offence a serious negligence, Judge Manoj Kumar, asked Bharti to appear in court. However, instead of Bharti, Deputy police superintendent Saroj Kumar Sah appeared in court and pleaded that there was no negligence knowingly.
